thread.title: Breeders’ Cup 2015: Pre-entries, odds for $5 million Classic
thread.title_full: Breeders’ Cup 2015: Pre-entries, odds for $5 million Classic

author: app.com
title: Breeders’ Cup 2015: Pre-entries, odds for $5 million Classic
text:
MORE The $5 million Breeders’ Cup Classic is next week and Triple Crown champion American Pharoah, two-time Breeders’ Cup winner Beholder and Travers Stakes winner Keen Ice will square off in the $5 million Breeders’ Cup Classic, with 2014 Belmont Stakes winner Tonalist in the field, too.
They are among a total of 200 horses which were pre-entered Wednesday for the $26 million, 13-race Breeders’ Cup world championships being held for the first time at Keeneland on Oct. 30 and 31.
Ten horses were pre-entered for the 1 1/4-mile Classic, which will be shown live in prime time on NBC.
American Pharoah, the 2015 William Hill Haskell Invitational winner, is expected to make his final start at the Lexington, Kentucky, track before being retired to stud.
The biggest challenge to American Pharoah trying to complete horse racing's "Grand Slam'' will be Beholder.
Beholder is looking to become the first horse in history to win three different Breeders’ Cup races and the first female to win the Classic since Zenyatta in 2009. Beholder won the 2012 Breeders’ Cup Juvenile Fillies and the 2013 Distaff.
Below are the odds (from Wynn Las Vegas) for the 10 entrants, which will hold until next week's post position draw:
American Pharoah (3-2)
Beholder (5-2)
Honor Code (6-1)
Tonalist (6-1)
Frosted (9-1)
Keen Ice (12-1)
Gleneagles (14-1)
Smooth Roller (15-1)
Hard Aces (50-1)
Effinex (75-1)
